description: The project Implementation of the RBEC GES 2008-11 describes in concrete terms how the RBEC will contribute towards the gender equality outcomes defined for the organization as a whole in its global SP and the parallel and complementary UNDP GES2008-11

subproject.description:
The project implementation of the RBEC GES 2008 -2013 draws on the complex transition and development process that have occurred in the region without full participation of women to suggest a feasible range of locally relevant and targeted activities and outputs that will lead to sustainable improvements in national capacity to identify and advance gender equality and ultimately contribute to long term improvement of women's situation in the region. The strategy features a  parallel programme of developing and strengthening internal capacity to ensure solid operations support to regional governments. It also includes other institutional arrangements that must be in place for meaningful enhancement of national capacity for gender equality programming.
The expected outputs are: 
Output 1: Enabled environments at the national and sub-regional levels for gender mainstreaming and women's empowerment from theory to concrete, result oriented practices and developed partner capacities. 
Output 2: Strengthened core gender mainstreaming capacity among gender practitioners in the region
subproject.gender code: Gender Equality as a principal objective
subproject.title: Implementation of the RBEC GES
